text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the fact the drunk driver was double the legal limit will be evidence in the truck driver's defense that the drunk driver's actions were unreasonable and thus intervening. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under section 3, stating: \"1. The driver was drunk\u2014double the legal limit. The more grossly negligent/reckless the intervening conduct, the more arguable it becomes that it is \u201cextraordinary.\u201d\" It further notes that the strongest defense for the truck driver is that the drunk driver\u2019s grossly negligent driving is a novus actus, which hinges on the unreasonableness of the drunk driver's conduct.", "criterion_id": "b3573ee1-8fb6-4d07-8572-3a1e1a5480e2"}
